key_points: Long-term care facilities accounted for 31% of all US COVID-19 deaths as of June 30, 2021.
Post-vaccine rollout, weekly cases and deaths in these facilities dropped to an all-time low in June 2021.
August 2021 saw a steep increase in COVID-19 cases and deaths in nursing homes due to the Delta variant.
Nearly 1,800 COVID-19 deaths were reported in US nursing homes in August 2021, the highest since February 2021.
COVID-19 deaths in nursing homes quadrupled between July and August 2021.
COVID-19 cases in nursing homes grew by 440% between July and August 2021.
The pandemic continues to disproportionately impact older adults and people with disabilities.
CDC endorsed an extra dose of the COVID-19 vaccine for residents of long-term care settings.
The Biden administration announced a staff vaccination mandate for nursing homes.
About 84% of nursing home residents and 64% of nursing home staff were vaccinated as of mid-September 2021.
